content: The price of writing has devalued to almost zero. Look at Kindle, market prices for a 100-page book are between $0.99 and $4.99. So the price we’re willing to pay authors has dropped to 1–5 cents per page per reader. I remember when books were $25–40 in the bookstore, but those days are long gone. It’s very hard nowadays to earn a living purely with writing. There are still a few well-paying online platforms available. Medium has started paying their top contributors (but I don’t know how much — they turned down my $150 pitch for a story ;). Seeking Alpha pays $35-$500 for a stock tip, which is basically just writing about finance. I’m sure there are others. I tried for a while to make a living on Seeking Alpha, but even with their generous payments I couldn’t make it work. I would have to churn out one article per day to make a living. With all the research involved, that was plainly impossible. I’ve abandoned writing as my primary source of income. I only do it on the side for brand awareness.
